Race.SpecificTitle: PW Courthouse & Jail Complex -- 2.34 Mills Renewal - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Propositions
(Courthouse and Jail Complex)
(Tax Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Lafayette, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), continue to levy a 2.34 mills tax on all the property subject to taxation in the Parish (an estimated $5,286,267 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2018 and ending with the year 2027, for the purposes of maintaining, operating and improving the Lafayette Parish Courthouse Complex?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW Min. Security Detention & Corr. Facility -- 2.06 Mills Renewal - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Propositions
(Minimum Security Detention and Correctional Facility)
(Tax Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Lafayette, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), continue to levy a 2.06 mills tax on all the property subject to taxation in the Parish (an estimated $4,653,718 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2018 and ending with the year 2027, for the purposes of maintaining, operating and improving the minimum security detention and correctional facility?

Race.SpecificTitle: Parishwide School Board -- 1/2% S&U - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish School Board of the Parish of Lafayette, State of Louisiana, be authorized to levy and collect a tax of one-half percent (1/2%) (the "Tax"), for ten (10) years, from and after October 1, 2017, upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, and the storage for use or consumption, of tangible personal property and on sales of services in Lafayette Parish, all as defined by law, except, as provided in Act 2 of 1982, the tax shall not be collected on food and prescription drug items presently exempted from state sales and use taxes under R.S. 47:305D(4) (formerly R.S. 47:305(4)), (an estimated $23,768,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), with the proceeds of the Tax (after paying the reasonable and necessary expenses of collecting and administering the Tax), being dedicated and used for any lawful purpose, including acquiring and/or improving lands for building sites and playgrounds, purchasing, erecting and/or improving schools and school related facilities within Lafayette Parish and acquiring the necessary equipment and furnishings therefor, subject to the limitations of Resolution No. 01-17-1896?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Lafayette -- 1.13 Mills Renewal - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Lafayette Proposition
(Public Buildings)
(Tax Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Lafayette, State of Louisiana (the "City") continue to levy a 1.13 mills tax on all the property subject to taxation in the City (an estimated $1,780,716 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2018 and ending with the year 2027, for the purposes of maintaining and operating public buildings of the City?
